awd_titl_txt: Management and Operation of the National Center for Atmospheric Research, 2008-2018, and Supporting Activities (USAF)
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

por.por_cntn:
This report represents projects that are funded by the United States Air Force and awarded through the National Science Foundation (NSF) Cooperative Agreement to the University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR) for the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR). NCAR provided logistics support and continued improvement of the dropsonde system for the benefit of the Air Force.

NCAR has been working and collaborating with the Air Force Hurricane Hunters since the early 1980s on Dropsonde systems and support. The Air Force has a fleet of ten WC-130J aircraft that are uniquely equipped as weather aircraft with a GPS Dropsonde system, in-situ sensors, and direct satellite communications to the ground for real-time weather data. The Dropsonde systems on the Air Force WC-130J were all developed and built by NCAR. The NCAR Dropsonde system is the only system in existence that meets the needs of the Air Force to support scientific and operational users, such as the National Hurricane Center. The GPS Dropsonde is one of the most important examples of NCAR and NSF's technology transfer and societal impact, especially in its hurricane use. NCAR involvement with this project ensured that consistent sensors and post-processing tools were used for Dropsonde observations available for scientific use, particularly by NSF grantees. This project included support for upgrading software and hardware as needed, which mutually benefited both NCAR and the Air Force technologically and at a reduced cost to each organization. Research efforts on this project also improved the many other research Dropsonde systems as technological improvements propagate to them.

Atmospheric Sounding Processing Environment (ASPEN) software developed at NCAR, which is the prime software tool for analysis and quality control of Dropsonde data for all NSF sponsored field programs, is made available to the to the domestic and international research and operational community. Presentations on dropsonde operations have also been provided at meetings and conferences.

 


Last Modified: 01/21/2022
Modified by: Everette D Joseph
